#1 dream / wish for 2014: get @ejfox twitter handle

Every artist should care about making beautiful things as much as a surgeon cares about saving lives.

Used to only drink water shipped to me from fiji
The Emotional Guidance Scale (Upward & Downward Spirals) http://t.co/kudVv9L1
Long live the Oakland Commune and Fuck The Police. #OccupyOakland

You don't have to listen to the other side's argument if YOU'RE RIGHT!!
Using the MPD24 to beatmatch is just straightup awesome.
I feel like the TSA taking away our pillows and blankets is sort of a tea-tax straw that breaks the camels back kinda deal. TEA PARTY.
Practicing beatmatching because I wanna be cool
Trying to put together a mix for Ben's party tomorrow. Downloading all the old classics.
And to this day I STILL HEAR NEW THINGS IN ANIMAL COLLECTIVE SONGS.
#notetoself When I get some extra time I should figure out how to use Mixxx for sampling: http://ejfox.com/mpd24mixxxsampler
Gonna DJ Ben's party tomorrow. Excited. Trying to figure out how exactly to do that.
@C0llegeKid Or a really fuzzy warm hospital gown.
WOW DISNEY YOUR SEGWAY OFFERINGS REALLY FUCKING SUCK, OKAY.
Delicious Library is having trouble scanning in my Make Magazine's- it can't find them anywhere! Gonna have to input 'em by hand...
Why exactly is Spotlight indexing my Time Machine drive?
Thinking it's about the right time to import everything into Delicious Library 2- I have a webcam & I'm moving books anyway. Hurrah hurrah.
I really need to cut my fingernails...
Having to add another bookshelf so I can add my christmas acquisitions to the collection... I'm gonna have to re-organize too.
I got a $50 iTunes card from my grandfather (along with some wonderful cutlery) so now I'm buying iPhone apps I'd never consider before. Yay
Here's today's momentile:  http://mtile.us/pseudoplacebo
@heyfuckyou Hey- if that happens count me in, too. Life would be perfect.
Bought tweetie. Not sure it lives up to all the hype but it's definitely fast.
This is a reminder to myself (and anyone else who can) to donate to WBEZ for This American Life. Possibly the best show on radio.
Here's today's momentile:  http://mtile.us/pseudoplacebo
Okay. That's it. I really want a cat.
Home. Finally finally home.
Not because I was especially happy, mind you.
So ridiculously tired... stayed up rather late & woke up rather early for christmas... and then saw many extendeddd family & smiled. A lot.
Chillin' with some camp peoples at the castle soon.
Trying to set up xbox live.
At the diner with Rebecca and Sara.
Should have been asleep a long time ago.
Tumblr: Mmmmm… http://tinyurl.com/2ckcb4
Home; finally.
Tomorrow; xbox 360 shopping. Any advice? Suggestions?
Thank god I don't live in "pluckimin" which we're driving through. Sorry pluckimians.
Going homeeeeee.

posts.dek: In which the author undertakes various personal and professional pursuits, from creating a photography website and scripting screenshot uploads to exploring new creative outlets and engaging in community initiatives.

In which the author navigates the complexities of balancing project management, coding challenges, and personal AI development while exploring new ways to showcase the Hudson Valley and enhance personal organization.
In which the author immerses themselves in learning about warfare footage and military equipment, experimenting with 3D graphics libraries, and preparing a first aid kit for motorcycle travel.
In which the author engages in interviews about glitch tokens and conducts a livestream on Coach Artie, showcasing a week filled with research and creativity.
In which the author partakes in the redesign of the Room 302 Studio website and engages in learning and development through a video lecture.
In which the author unveils a new studio site, delves into Electology plans, and experiences their first personal training session at the gym.

In which the author braves a snowstorm on their motorcycle, enjoys watercolor painting with friends, indulges in a Lindsay Lohan movie night, and charts plans for automated text descriptions of screenshots and improved asset management in Obsidian.
In which the author meticulously crafts a cyberpunk visual aesthetic and explores the Hudson Valley through digital elevation models and contour maps.
In which the author diligently works on multiple projects, explores new creative techniques, achieves technical accomplishments, and focuses on personal well-being and future goals.
In which the author embarks on creative endeavors in pottery, updates personal projects, and enhances backend functionalities for Coach Artie & Brain View.

In which the author contemplates a potential move, works on creative projects, achieves technical milestones, delves into video transcription methods, enjoys entertainment, focuses on personal health, and sets goals for the future.

In which the author explores the realms of memory and creativity through scrapbooking, pottery-making, and technical innovations, culminating in a showcase of projects and a foray into pricing models.
